Context:
The School of Management offers a Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA) degree program specializing in Business Analytics. This program focuses on teaching students an applied framework for interpreting data from multiple sources to make effective business decisions. The curriculum covers business intelligence models, data management, data insights and frameworks, data-science-based decisions, value-creation opportunities, and various analytics approaches. Students will learn practical applications of current analytics technologies and skills development, including programming using the latest software, applied statistical comprehension, and database understanding.

The program is delivered in an online format for the first two years and in-person for the latter two years. International students can study the first two years remotely from their home country without a study permit. They must apply for a study permit well in advance to begin year three (5th semester) and will be eligible for a post-graduation work permit if successful.

The School of Management offers various academic programs and industry projects, such as the Analytics Hub, Humology Lab, Consulting Hub, and Enactus, a social innovation platform. Graduates can find opportunities in high-demand sectors like banking, government, pharmaceutical, finance, health care, and telecommunications, where businesses have access to an abundance of data.

Upon completion of the program, graduates will be able to tackle big data and leverage it for better business decision-making and outcomes. They will also know the differences between various analytics approaches and be prepared for an analytics role in any country.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Honours Bachelor of Business Administration Program (Business Analytics) B303 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The program offers a Bachelor in Business Administration (Business Analytics) degree. Students are required to complete 42 courses and 1 Integrated Experience to graduate. The work-integrated learning experiences amount to no less than 14 weeks of full-time equivalent work (420 hours). Graduates may be eligible for a post-graduation work permit.

Common job titles for Business Analytics graduates include: analyst – data science / data mining, business analyst I & II, data scientist, marketing insights & analytic specialist, marketing specialist, performance analyst I & II, senior analyst, data insights and analytics, senior HR analyst data & insights, and senior manager/director – data science/data mining.

The industry growth is projected at 14% by 2024, creating a demand for highly skilled workers in various sectors like pharmaceutical, banking, health, manufacturing, natural resources, financial and government services. Over 182,000 ICT workers were required to be hired in Canada by 2019 with an additional 36,000 workers by 2020.

Students must complete 34 mandatory courses and 8 Liberal Arts courses of their choice from the Arts and Humanities, Social Science, or Science & Technology.

Program learning outcomes:
1. Create, evaluate, and interpret insights for business decision-makers based on current theories, concepts, and practices in business intelligence and analytics.
2. Analyze external and internal factors to identify impact on the organization’s resources, outputs, and operations.
3. Evaluate and use practices from a wide range of business disciplines to support the success of the organization.
4. Conduct qualitative and quantitative research and research analysis to aid in decision-making and strategic planning.
5. Synthesize data sets of data mining software and data science methods to extract relevant variables for business decision-makers.
6. Assess the suitability and support of business data for business decision-making.
7. Analyze trends in data to identify directions for business decision making.
8. Create accurate and professional written, oral, digital, and visual communications that recognize and adapt to contextual factors.
9. Innovate through engagement.

Tuition & Fees:
- Domestic Tuition (first two semesters): $7,553.00
- International Tuition (estimated, first two semesters): $20,357.00
- Additional costs: Not provided in the text
- Work Experience semester fees (for domestic students): Included in first year tuition

Admission Requirements:
- Applicants must have an Ontario Secondary School Diploma with six grade 12 university (U) or university/college (M) courses
- Grade 12 (U) English and math are required
- Minimum grades: At least 60% in all prerequisite courses, an overall average of 65% in six grade 12 (U) or (M) courses
- Recommended courses: basic computer software applications and calculus and vectors (MCV4U)
- Mature Student status (19 years of age or older and no OSSD): Required to have grade 12 (U) English and math, a grade of 65% or higher.

Disclaimer: The information is subject to change without notice. Students are responsible for verifying the fee requirements with George Brown College.

Context:
* The applicants are required to have a grade of 65 per cent or higher in English and mathematics at the grade 12 (U-level) for degree programs.
* English language proficiency requirements: George Brown College ESL Level 9, TOEFL 84 overall with a minimum of 21 in each skill band (online), IELTS 6.5 overall with a minimum of 6.0 in each skill band, MELAB 85, CAEL overall 70 (writing 60).
* Some college and university credits may qualify for exemptions. Check the transfer guide for more information.
* George Brown College has been granted a consent by the Ministry of Colleges and Universities to offer an applied degree for a seven-year term starting from December 21, 2020. The college will submit an application for renewal of the consent 12 months prior to the expiration.
* International students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System. They can find more information on country-specific admission requirements on the International Admissions page.
* Information sessions are held on a regular basis. Domestic students can apply through Ontario Colleges, and international students can check the How to Apply page for instructions.
* For inquiries about domestic admission requirements or the admissions process, contact the college.

For domestic student inquiries about admission requirements, deadlines, or the admissions process, contact the Admissions Office at admissions@georgebrown.ca or visit the Admissions section.

For international student inquiries, contact one of the international recruitment representatives by booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry on the International Contact Us page.

For financial aid inquiries (OSAP, Bursaries, Scholarships), contact the Financial Aid Office at FinAid@georgebrown.ca or visit the Financial Aid section.

To make an appointment with an Entry Advisor for advice on program options, review these frequently asked questions.

The Honours Bachelor of Business Administration (Business Analytics) B303 program is offered out of the Centre for Business and classes usually take place at the St. James Campus, mainly at 200 King St. E., and 290 Adelaide St. E., Toronto, ON, Canada. Campus tours and info sessions can be booked.

Contact the Centre for Business at business@georgebrown.ca or phone (416) 415-5000 ext. 2160. For inquiries related to the B303 program, contact the co-ordinator Robin Yap at ryalp@georgebrown.ca or Elizabeth Speers, Academic Director, Centre for Business, at espeers@georgebrown.ca.

Follow the Centre for Business on Instagram and LinkedIn.

International students can contact international recruitment representatives by booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry on the International Contact Us page.

Campus tours are offered regularly and a virtual tour is also available. To book a campus tour or get answers to your questions, book an info session. Sign up today!
